required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Conversion Therapy of Sintilimab in Combination With Apatinib and Chemotherapy in Unresectable Gastric Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Conversion Therapy of Sintilimab in Combination With Apatinib and Chemotherapy in Unresectable Gastric Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital

clinical_study.source: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase II study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of combination of sintilimab (PD-1 inhibitor) , apatinib and chemotherapy in unresectable advanced gastric cancer patients with oligo metastasis. This study was designed as single arm with fixed number of participants.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: eligible patients will be given sintilimab, apatinib and xelox treatment each 3 weeks

primary_outcome.description: number of R0 surgery divide all participants (30pts)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 30 days after last treatment administration
secondary_outcome.description: all grades of adverse events, all grades of treatment related adverse events, serious of adverse events
R0 surgery patient divide on all converted surgery patient

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 24 weeks from the first date of drugs administration
secondary_outcome.description: the best over all response during treatment according to RECIST criteria
median OS or OS rate in two years

arm_group.description: eligible patients will be given sintilimab (200mg, iv, q3w,)， apatinib (250mg/d， QD)，S1 （50mg PO，b.i.d d1-14 ）and nab-paclitaxel (260mg, iv, 3h, d1,q3w) for 3-6 cycles. If patients converted to surgery, then administer treatment post surgery upto 3cycles. Then give sintilimab and apatinib each 3 weeks for maintenance .

intervention.description: sintilimab is checkpoint inhibitor via blocking PD-1 (programmed cell death-1) site of signaling.
a multi-target anti-angiogenic tyrosine kinase inhibitor (TKI)

S-1 is an oral fluoropyrimidine consisting of tegafur (a prodrug that is converted to fluorouracil, mainly in liver microsomes but also in tumour tissue), gimeracil (an inhibitor of dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase, which degrades 5-FU), and oteracil (which inhibits the phosphorylation of 5-FU in the gastrointestinal tract, thereby reducing the toxic effects of 5-FU in the intestinum).
Nab paclitaxel is a albumin-bound well tolerated paclitaxel than traditional paclitaxel

facility.name: Department of Gastrointestinal Medical Oncology, Tianjin Medical University Cancer Hospital
